intro: Elytranthe obmunita, commonly known as the rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in a fine layer of pubescence. Elytranthe obmunita produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by small, capsule-like fruits.
